definitions: To express approval or support for (someone or something), especially publicly.
To sign (a check or bill of exchange) on the back to make it payable to someone other than the stated payee.
To write a clause on a contract or insurance policy transferring one's rights and duties to another.
examples: The company decided to endorse the new product line.
She needs to endorse the check before depositing it.
The insurance policy was endorsed to include the new driver.
